title: So I got 2 S+'s back to back!
body:
Getting an S+ used to be a big goal of mine, but now they come all the time! High CS, a great kill-participation rate and great objective control are all big factors in whether or not you make the cut! :P

If you're working towards it too, here are my stats (to give you an idea of what to work towards):

Nid
http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/123201110/200093284?tab=overview

Ahri
http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/123202806/200093284?tab=overview

What I found was when I was less focused on the end result, and more focused on how to improve my gameplay, I did a lot better!

I have a pretty low mmr, but for my league I'm doing really well! :) 

GOOD LUCK FELLOW PEOPLE WHO LIKE TO BE GRADED!

clearly you don't understand it that well.
I've had games where i've taken like 3-4 towers by myself and gone like 15/3/8 or something but had shit cs and only gotten an A+ or S- ranking.
but I've had other games where I've gone like 5/3/9 and only been involved in taking like 2 towers, yet had way more CS than anyone in the game and had an S+ ranking.
CS is the biggest factor in determining whether or not you got an S+ ranking or just an S or S-

It isn't a set rating, it's based on performance percentages. The rank that you get is determined by where you sit in the rankings for that champion in that role. S+ is the top 2% as far as I know.

If you did well with say, Nami mid, you are pretty much guaranteed and S+. But getting an S+ with say, Vayne ADC is much much harder because it's played so much more and there are plenty of people that main her and do well consistently with her.

If your CS is well into that top 2% then it will certainly boost your rating, but if you then had a much worse kill participation it would drop a lot as well. It is a combination of many things, CS is no more important than kill participation or anything else, and the scores you need vary drastically from champ to champ and role to role.
